column1: 1. The hotel can accommodate up to 500 guests.

1. The teacher explained the movement of light by analogy with the movement of water.
2. It is sometimes easier to illustrate an abstract concept by analogy with something concrete.
3. The teacher drew an analogy between the human heart and a pump.
4. The experience of mystic trance is in a sense analogous to sleep or drunkenness.

1. A good speaker is able to anticipate an audienceÅfs needs and concerns.

3. The workers have called off their strike in anticipation of a pay offer.
4. As with most pleasures, itÅfs not so much the experience itself as the anticipation that is enjoyable.
[related words] assurance, assurances, assured, assuredly, assures, assuring
1. The Prime Minister assured the electorate that taxes would not be increased after the election.
2. We were assured that everything possible was being done.
3. He gave an assurance that the work would be completed by Wednesday.
4. These problems might not be solved by money alone, but they will assuredly not be solved without it.
